data.title: Win 8.1 build issue
data.body:
Ran a 'git pull' to get the latest changes, they fixed most of the things but then i got this one:

E:\Documents\GitHub\atom [master]> script/build
Node: v0.10.28
Python: v2.7.7
npm WARN package.json github-url-from-git@1.1.1 No repository field.

Removing envify done

gyp info it worked if it ends with ok
gyp info using node-gyp@0.12.2
gyp info using node@0.10.26 | win32 | ia32
gyp http GET https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist/v0.11.10/node-v0.11.10.tar.gz
gyp http 200 https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist/v0.11.10/node-v0.11.10.tar.gz
gyp http GET https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist/v0.11.10/node.lib
gyp http GET https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist/v0.11.10/x64/node.lib
gyp http 200 https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist/v0.11.10/x64/node.lib
gyp http 200 https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist/v0.11.10/node.lib
gyp WARN install got an error, rolling back install
gyp
E:\Documents\GitHub\atom [master]>

Ran a 'script/clean' to see if that would fix the issues and now when i run 'script/build' i get this:

E:\Documents\GitHub\atom [master]> script/build
Node: v0.10.28
Python: v2.7.7
'E:\Documents\GitHub\atom\build\node_modules.bin\npm' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.

Ran an 'npm' and it returned with usage on how to use 'npm', so i know that is installed.

data.title: Snippets expanding _and_ running editor:indent
data.body:
It isn't like this all the time, but after ~10 minutes of usage it does this:

![snippets-issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/3193382/eff5f326-ecf1-11e3-978b-13816684e298.gif)

Note the extra spaces after the expanded snippet and the last command being editor:indent.

Not sure where the issue actually is, though. Maybe this should be on the snippets repo?

I am using the react editor.

data.title: Build issue on windows 8.1 x64 studio 2013
data.body:
C:\atom [master]> script/build
Node: v0.10.28
Python: v2.7.6
npm WARN package.json github-url-from-git@1.1.1 No repository field.

C:\atom\apm\node_modules\atom-package-manager\script\download-node.js:28
  return request(url).pipe(stream);
         ^
TypeError: object is not a function
    at downloadFileToLocation (C:\atom\apm\node_modules\atom-package-manager\script\download-node.js:28:10)
    at downloadNode (C:\atom\apm\node_modules\atom-package-manager\script\download-node.js:72:12)
    at Object.<anonymous> (C:\atom\apm\node_modules\atom-package-manager\script\download-node.js:79:1)
    at Module._compile (module.js:456:26)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:474:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:312:12)
    at Function.Module.runMain (module.js:497:10)
    at startup (node.js:119:16)
    at node.js:906:3
npm ERR! atom-package-manager@0.64.0 install: `node ./script/download-node.js`
npm ERR! Exit status 8
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Failed at the atom-package-manager@0.64.0 install script.
npm ERR! This is most likely a problem with the atom-package-manager package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
npm ERR! Tell the author that this fails on your system:
npm ERR!     node ./script/download-node.js
npm ERR! You can get their info via:
npm ERR!     npm owner ls atom-package-manager
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! System Windows_NT 6.2.9200
npm ERR! command "node" "C:\atom\build\node_modules\npm\bin\npm-cli.js" "--userconfig=C:\atom\.npmrc" "install"
"--quiet"
npm ERR! cwd C:\atom\apm
npm ERR! node -v v0.10.28
npm ERR! npm -v 1.4.13
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npmC:\atom [master]> script/build
# 

I have latest windows 8.1 x64 with all updates
visual studio ultimate 2013
atom version: just cloned commit: d16bd0d7eb

data.title: :memo: Add documentation for Atom.io Star API
Code hiding jumps to cursor position
data.body:
When hiding code, the screen jumps to wherever the cursor is.  

Mac OSX 10.8.5

data.title: Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded

data.title: "Only in selection" icon is misleading
data.body:
Atom is using a double quote for the "Only in selection" find option. But the icon and the button placement is the same as Sublime's "Whole word" option (which does a `\b...\b` search.) It took me a few minutes to realize why my search was not working!

It would be better to use a different icon, maybe the word `Sel` or an icon that looks like a selection with a cursor beside it: ▇ ▏

data.title: Colors are off (or different?) in the React editor
data.body:
Here is a comparison using the standard Solarized theme (Atom 0.100.0 on OS X)

Either the colors in the react editor are too saturated, or the ones in the classic editor are too gray:

![colors](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/48756/3186292/c11291c4-ec9f-11e3-9bac-efbe7f501fab.png)

The inspector show the hex colors to be the same. "Solid" spots are also the same across both screenshots (see the background or the underline character.) So it would seem a difference in the font anti-aliasing mechanism.

I'm not sure which rendering is the right one. I like the classic look better, but it's subjective.

data.title: Add alt-# shortcuts for pane switching in linux
Add clickable fold icon to gutter
data.body:
This adds a clickable fold icon in the gutter of the react editor; refs #1984 and #2423.

This also simplifies the `GutterComponent`. I did not notice performance differences after following the benchmark instructions in https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/2325#issuecomment-43952215 (but I may have misread).

If the `GutterComponent` changes are not acceptable I can resubmit without them.

Screenshot:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/253202/3183215/08a7f0fa-ec65-11e3-91de-209509dc4a6e.png)

data.title: Changing mkdeb script
Add an API for decorations; render stuff in the gutter again
data.body:
A decoration is an object attached to a buffer row. Here's a decoration:

``` js
{type: 'gutter', class: 'my-sweet-class'}
```

And here is how to attach it to a buffer row:

``` coffee
editor.addDecorationToBufferRow(1, {type: 'gutter', class: 'my-sweet-class'})
```

Currently the only thing that renders a decoration is the `GutterComponent` and it only cares about decorations with `type: 'gutter'`. It will add the decoration's `class` property as a class to the proper line-number node in the gutter. 

The neat thing is that the `GutterComponent` handles all the bs with updating as line number nodes are added and removed. So no more watching the `display-updated` event and manually updating classes in packages like `git-diff` and `bookmarks`.
### Markers

There is a marker API as well. Packages like `bookmarks` should not be watching the markers and updating their decorations manually. 

``` coffee
marker = editor.displayBuffer.markBufferRange([[2, 13], [3, 15]], class: 'my-marker', invalidate: 'inside')
decoration = {type: 'gutter', class: 'marker-class'}
editor.addDecorationToMarker(marker, decoration)
```

The class `marker-class` will properly track the marker's rows on the gutter.
### Options

Sometimes you might want a decoration to show on wrapped lines (git-diff), and sometimes you dont (bookmarks), so there is an option: `softWrap`. Like so: `{type: 'gutter', class: 'marker-class', softWrap: true}`. If you have ideas on how better to pass options, let me know.
### Removing decorations

Currently you can only remove them on each buffer row. Like finding markers, it will remove any decoration that matches the pattern.

``` coffee
editor.addDecorationToBufferRow(1, {type: 'gutter', class: 'my-sweet-class', namespace: 'cats'})
editor.addDecorationToBufferRow(1, {type: 'gutter', class: 'my-other-class', namespace: 'cats'})

# this will remove the previous two
editor.removeDecorationFromBufferRow(1, {namespace: 'cats'})

# usually you'll probably just have one class and do this
editor.removeDecorationFromBufferRow(1, {type: 'gutter', class: 'my-other-class'})
```

The api works the same for marker decorations. 
### TODO
- [x] Deprecate the old gutter methods
- [x] Figure out where to put this api. @nathansobo on the `ReactEditorView`? Now its on `Editor`.
- [x] Maybe pull the folds out to be decorations??
- [x] Docs
- [x] Tests for `cursor-line` decoration
- [x] Add a `cursor-line-no-selection` decoration
- [x] Tests for 'typeless' decorations

Fixes #1984

data.title: Add concrete install instructions for Fedora Linux
Windows: Backslash does not work with German keyboard layout
data.body:
I have a problem with the Backslash key in a Windows build with an german keyboard layout => if I press it, it do nothing :-(

I've using 0.99 and 0.101, both has this effect. The builds are from http://atom.someguy123.com/#sthash.CckD7V8Q.dpbs. I'm using Windows 7 x64 SP1

Does anybody has the same problem?

Greetings

data.title: font-size weirdness / suggestion
data.body:
This isn't necessarily broken, but just something odd I've run into. I teach a class, and use Atom for my editor to show examples of code. Since my code is being projected on a screen to a classroom, I have my font-size set crazy high. Like, ridiculously high. The issue is that when I create a new file or folder, the text inside that field is that same size in which no one is able to see what I'm typing.

Here is a screenshot of what that looks like. Maybe as a suggestion, that text field could remain a normal size?

![screen shot 2014-06-04 at 1 45 21 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2391/3179005/cf98c436-ec20-11e3-9193-469b210d39a7.png)

data.title: Add debugging guide
data.body: This is the first part of a guide on debugging problems and errors in Atom. I'll add more stuff to this PR (e.g. starting Atom in safe mode), but there's enough text already in here to get some feedback.

data.title: MSBuild version errors in nested packages (vs2013)
data.body:
When I'm trying to build atom, everything goes fine until I hit "nested packages", so for example the atom spell-checker that depends on spellchecker. 
When it's trying to build spellchecker I get this error: 

> C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V120\Microsoft.Cpp.Platform.targets(64,5): error MSB8020: The build to
> ols for Visual Studio 2012 (Platform Toolset = 'v110') cannot be found. 

That's super weird because the folder it's erroring from is v120 (vs2013) but it references v110 (vs2012) in the message. 

However when I manually run 

> npm install spellchecker

It's building just fine

data.title: Check python version to verify requirements, addition to #2457
data.body:
Hey @probablycorey, i took a stab at adding a python version check onto #2457.

i'm not entirely happy with it at the moment... i don't like that i threw a callback in there, but i couldn't find a way of executing `python` synchronously that wouldn't require me pulling in a ton more code from other npm modules.

i doubt this is perfect, but i gave this a try and figured i'd share what i came up with. i'm still learning :smile:.

data.title: Log error when a command fails
data.body:
## The problem

When brand-new, like me, the problem could be anywhere, so I'm clumsily looking at **everything** to try and figure out where the issue is. All I can see is that nothing happens. The specific issue was that I had the command correctly loaded into the `activationEvents` in the json file, and my "lib/my-project.coffee" worked correctly, but I didn't have the `main` set up to load the file (because I generated it with `$ apm init --convert` to load my TextMate plugin rather than with `generate:package`).

I assume what happens is that when I run the command, it goes to find the command, which should be there because it is added in the `activate` key. But it is not there since the file did not get loaded. Because it is not there, it silently fails and removes the commands from the list of commands.
## The desired behaviour

Ideally, the system would log enough information for me to figure out where the issue is.

Keep in mind that I'm very very new so I have very little ability to troubleshoot based on reasoning about the system. I'd like to know it's not in my keymap file, it's not in my package.json. Something like this would be helpful: "my-package:my-command was registered as an activationEvent, but could not be found as a command." maybe also a link to common reasons this could happen such as: the command was never, the name is wrong (describing a way to see the list of registered commands in the given namespace would help a lot here), the file was never required, the file wasn't specified in the main command of package.json.
## Another Possibility

I don't know if it's reasonable to have .coffee files in lib without having a main in package.json, but maybe a linting of package.json would catch this? Or maybe there's a combination of things: files in lib, no main, commands in activationList. If this is something that could be caught, it would also be nice if it would run automatically on saving of package.json

data.title: Moving file out of folder gives error
data.body:
After moving a file into a parent folder (not in Atom), I get an error:

"Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getScreenRow' of undefined /usr/local/google/home/skainswo/Atom/resources/app/src/editor.js:1311"

data.title: Add shims to the React View Editor
data.body:
:game_die: WIP :game_die:

If there are other parts of the API that break please respond to this issue with the package and the API it relies on.
### EditorView
- [x] `scrollView` outlet is missing.
- [x] getEditor
- [x] getFirstVisibleScreenRow
- [x] getFontFamily
- [x] getFontSize
- [x] getLastVisibleScreenRow
- ~~getPageRows~~ Ignoring this method, [I couldn't find it used anywhere](https://github.com/search?q=pageRows+extension%3Acoffee+extension%3Ajs+path%3A%2Flib&type=Code&ref=searchresults)
- [x] getPane
- [ ] highlightFoldsContainingBufferRange ([could probably be removed from the API](https://github.com/search?q=highlightFoldsContainingBufferRange+extension%3Acoffee+extension%3Ajs&type=Code&ref=searchresults) but it needs to be replaced in [SelectionView](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/e3641286e71447a79666682edf04570b156b67cc/src/selection-view.coffee#L25))
- [ ] isScreenRowVisible  ([could probably be removed from the API](https://github.com/search?q=isScreenRowVisible+extension%3Acoffee+extension%3Ajs&type=Code&ref=searchresults))
- [x] pageDown
- [x] pageUp
- [x] pixelPositionForBufferPosition
- [x] pixelPositionForScreenPosition
- [x] redraw
- [x] scrollToBottom
- [x] scrollToBufferPosition
- [x] scrollToCursorPosition
- [x] scrollToPixelPosition
- [x] scrollToScreenPosition
- [x] setFontFamily
- [x] setFontSize
- [ ] setInvisibles (I think we could ignore this one, its [not used](https://github.com/search?q=setInvisibles+extension%3Acoffee+extension%3Ajs&type=Code&ref=searchresults) and can be set via config)
- [x] setLineHeight
- [ ] setPlaceholderText (this is only used by mini-editors and we are going to [wait on implementing it](https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/be201485188cb8583bbfe0a2dd239a20efa8cbd9#commitcomment-6621306))
- [x] setShowIndentGuide
- [x] setShowInvisibles
- [x] setSoftWrap
- [x] splitDown
- [x] splitLeft
- [x] splitRight
- [x] splitUp
- [x] toggleSoftTabs
- [x] toggleSoftWrap

Based on feedback from @abe33 and @smashwilson and anything I've run into personally.
Closes #2428

data.title: OS X "open with" menu has every version of Atom, ever
data.body:
This may be a result of being an early user (or something I did wrong), if so, feel free to #wontfix, but if I right click an MD file and select "open with" to open in Chrome on OS X, I get what I believe to be every version ever installed as an option. Verified in Applications that only one version exists, as far as I can tell:

![screen shot 2014-06-03 at 4 07 31 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/282759/3165928/da6abb92-eb5a-11e3-88ef-42c84c5386fe.png)

data.title: Opening empty folder crashes
data.body:
When attempting to open an empty folder in Atom, the editor turns grey and hangs indefinitely. The output looks something like:

```
[18805:0603/115749:INFO:CONSOLE(1)] "Uncaught ReferenceError: start is not defined", source: file:///<folder-path>/ (1)
[18805:0603/115749:INFO:CONSOLE(2)] "Uncaught ReferenceError: addRow is not defined", source: file:///<folder-path>/ (2)
```

I'm on Ubuntu and version 0.98.0-d1ed176.

data.title: keybinding pane:show-item-# doesn't work in linux
data.body:
Trying to bind pane switching by number doesn't work in linux, e.g.

```
'body':
  'alt-1': 'pane:show-item-1'
  'alt-2': 'pane:show-item-2'
```

data.title: Add links to build error reports in build docs
data.body: Adds search links to build docs for Linux/Windows/OSX so that it's easier to find other build error reports.

data.title: :penguin: Make "Developer Tools" key binding match Chrome
data.body: In Chrome on Linux, the Developer Tools open with <kbd>Ctrl+Shift+I</kbd>. Since many Linux devs have that shortcut hardwired into their brain, it makes a lot of sense for Atom to use it too.

data.title: "TypeError: cannot call method 'executeJavaScript' of null"
data.body:
I believe I got this error while trying to open a folder but I didn't notice it until I had closed a few windows. I'm running on Ubuntu.

![atomerror](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/226872/3163640/b5de8e20-eb41-11e3-931d-1abd58fcdcd4.png)

data.title: Inside of an html tag opening and closing a script tag produces unwantde
data.body:
When closing a script tag </script> the editor automatically adds another "script" to the end - before the closing caret.  Screenshot attached.

![screen shot 2014-06-03 at 11 06 35 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/486049/3161971/fc6033be-eb30-11e3-8b8c-56a4785169af.png)

data.title: "Find in Project" action (Cmd+Shift+F) ignores currently selected text
data.body: When I select a text and hit Cmd+F then currently selected text is already copied to "Find in current buffer" input field. However, the same is not happening with Cmd+Shift+F ("Find in Project"), forcing one to copy-paste a text there. This not only takes longer but also destroys a previous clipboard content.
